summary: This document is an email chain from December 31, 2019, discussing the status of the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation by the SDNY and FBI. It mentions a poorly conducted interview with a cooperator in California, plans for further witness interviews, and concerns about coordinating Maxwell's arrest with an upcoming ABC News special report on Jeffrey Epstein to maintain credibility with victims.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain discusses the status of the investigation and potential arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Referenced in the context of an upcoming ABC News special report about him, which is influencing the timing considerations for Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Amy Robach
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded news article link about ABC News planning special reports on Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell is under investigation in connection with Epstein's sex trafficking operation, as indicated by the discussion of arresting 'Maxwell and' (likely other co-conspirators).

events.title: Interview with cooperator in California
events.description: An interview with a cooperator in California related to the Maxwell investigation reportedly did not go very well.

events.title: Scheduled ABC News special report on Epstein
events.description: ABC News planned to air special reports on Jeffrey Epstein, featuring anchor Amy Robach. The email discusses the need to time Maxwell's arrest relative to this broadcast.

events.title: Target completion for Maxwell investigation
events.description: The hope expressed in the email is to have the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation wrapped up by the end of January 2020.

keyFacts: A prosecutorial memo regarding 'all co-conspirators' had gone up the chain at the SDNY and was under review by chiefs as of December 31, 2019.
An interview with a cooperator in California for the Maxwell investigation 'did not go very well,' indicating investigative challenges.

Law enforcement officials were concerned that arresting Ghislaine Maxwell after an ABC News special on Epstein (scheduled for January 9, 2020) would make it appear they were merely reacting to the news, potentially damaging credibility with victims.
The FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force was involved in the investigation and offered to 'press' the SDNY if needed to expedite arrests.
The email chain shows internal coordination and timing strategy discussions between law enforcement personnel regarding a high-profile arrest.
